page.title: 05Fire Stations in Skegness
page.content: { {The fire-station}is on{Burgh Road}but this has not always been so.During the war there were three fire-stations in Skegness.One was on Wainfleet Road, one at the Vine Hotel and the main one on Roman Bank.The firestation on Burgh Road was opened by Councillor F.T Hepworth on the 8th May 1973.The Skegness Fire Brigade was started in 1725 about 200 years ago.When it first started the fire engines were hand carts with buckets of water.In 1910 the horse drawn carts came in. Modern day fire engines cost fifty thousand pounds.Skegness comes under B division.The longest running fire lasted one week.To be a fireman you have to be at least five foot seven and they have to pass certain tests. The Hydraulic Platform can reach up to sixty five feet.
